btw, if you do lock yourself out of a box like this, unless someone has passworded the kernel boot options you can always do the linux init=/bin/sh trick to deliver yourself to a root prompt
if your bootloader isn't passworded you could get into a system with <image> rw init=/bin/sh
but maybe the reason you can't log in would cause problems then too.
